text: Ruth Bader Ginsburg: Who are the justices on the US Supreme Court? https://t.co/VS8Dr9OUfJ

name: BBCWorld
text:
US Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg has died, age 87

Here are 10 things you need to know about her life (THREAD) https://t.co/Kp690PlJdc

name: BBCWorld
text:
1.    She was born to Jewish immigrant parents in the Flatbush neighbourhood of Brooklyn, New York City, in 1933

Her mother, Celia Bader, died of cancer the day before Ginsburg left high school https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/O6GcohOvfd

name: BBCWorld
text:
2.   She met her husband, Martin Ginsburg, on a blind date

They got married in 1954, shortly after she graduated university, and had a daughter, Jane, a year later

She called her husband “my best friend and biggest booster”. He died in 2010 from cancer https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/sZqQFmr4IX

name: BBCWorld
text:
3. In 1956, Ginsburg became one of nine women accepted to Harvard Law School

She transferred to Columbia Law School after her husband got a job in NYC

No firm would hire her: "I struck out on three grounds: I was Jewish, a woman and a mother” 
https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/gcIQYHFyqL

name: BBCWorld
text:
https://t.co/MBVKQFTnAz 1971, Ginsburg made her first successful argument before the Supreme Court

The case was Reed v Reed, which examined whether men could be automatically preferred over women as estate executors

The court agreed with her 
https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/Pdqf4MdYem

name: BBCWorld
text:
4. In 1971, Ginsburg made her first successful argument before the Supreme Court

The case was Reed v Reed, which examined whether men could be automatically preferred over women as estate executors

The court agreed with her https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/zUYV3imXtu

name: BBCWorld
text:
In 1980, Ginsburg was nominated to the United States Court of Appeals

Though Ginsburg was often portrayed as a liberal firebrand, her days on the appeals court were marked by moderation, and she voted with conservatives many times

https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/PplT4UOgyV

name: BBCWorld
text:
5. In 1980, Ginsburg was nominated to the United States Court of Appeals

Though Ginsburg was often portrayed as a liberal firebrand, her days on the appeals court were marked by moderation, and she voted with conservatives many times
https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/cWqAztocKU

name: BBCWorld
text:
6. She was nominated to the Supreme Court in 1993 by President Clinton after a lengthy search process

Ginsburg was the second woman ever confirmed to that bench, following Sandra Day O'Connor https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/nO6WEzcSHO

name: BBCWorld
text:
4. In 1971, Ginsburg made her first successful argument before the Supreme Court

The case was Reed v Reed, which examined whether men could be automatically preferred over women as estate executors

The court agreed with her https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/n8UfqMc6l5

name: BBCWorld
text:
5. In 1980, Ginsburg was nominated to the United States Court of Appeals

Though Ginsburg was often portrayed as a liberal firebrand, her days on the appeals court were marked by moderation, and she voted with conservatives many times
https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/lUSxGLuoRL

name: BBCWorld
text:
6. She was nominated to the Supreme Court in 1993 by President Clinton after a lengthy search process

Ginsburg was the second woman ever confirmed to that bench, following Sandra Day O'Connor https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/KzMrnQHWQZ

name: BBCWorld
text:
7. During her time on the bench, Justice Ginsburg moved noticeably to the left

Her dissents were forceful - occasionally biting - and Ginsburg did not shy away from criticising her colleagues' opinions https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/1KsQNqzoSr

name: BBCWorld
text:
8. In 2015, Ginsburg sided with the majority on two landmark cases

The court upheld a crucial component of the 2010 Affordable Care Act, commonly known as Obamacare

And she sided with the 5-4 majority, legalising same-sex marriage in all 50 states https://t.co/lxPdWgUWWP https://t.co/hZO5X1PDXs
